Vulnerability.Title: irqbalance bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The irqbalance packages provide a daemon that evenly distributes the interrupt request (IRQ) load across multiple CPUs for enhanced performance. This update fixes the following bug: When the irqbalance service was started or restarted, it incorrectly rebalanced IRQs, including the banned ones. This update ensures that IRQ affinity does not change shortly after irqbalance assigns it. As a result, starting and restarting irqbalance no longer performs an unintended rebalance operation, and honors the setting of banned IRQs. (BZ#1242626) Users of irqbalance are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
